description: This file implements the core functions for managing an HTTP Transaction Record Object, including creation, initialization, enrollment of subordinate objects, and cleanup. It defines functions to create and destroy HTTP transaction objects, set up associated interfaces, and initialize member variables specific to HTTP transaction state management.

classes.name: HTTP_TRANS_RECORD_OBJECT
classes.description: Represents an HTTP transaction record, encapsulating connection state, interface pointers, synchronization primitives, and transaction-specific parameters.

classes.name: HTTP_TMH_INTERFACE
classes.description: Interface structure for HTTP Transaction Management Handlers, including callback functions for notification and serialization.

methods.name: ANSC_HANDLE HttpTroCreate(ANSC_HANDLE hContainerContext,ANSC_HANDLE hOwnerContext,ANSC_HANDLE hAnscReserved)
methods.description: Constructs a new HTTP Transaction Record Object, allocating memory and setting up basic properties and member functions.

methods.name: ANSC_STATUS HttpTroRemove(ANSC_HANDLE hThisObject)
methods.description: Destroys the HTTP Transaction Record Object, freeing associated resources and memory.

methods.name: ANSC_STATUS HttpTroEnrollObjects(ANSC_HANDLE hThisObject)
methods.description: Enrolls subordinate interface objects used for transaction management, allocating memory if necessary.

methods.name: ANSC_STATUS HttpTroInitialize(ANSC_HANDLE hThisObject)
methods.description: Initializes the HTTP Transaction Record Object’s member variables and function pointers to default or specified values.
